###User Defined Function###
_WordDocPropertySet

###Description###
Set a select property of the Word Document

###Syntax###
#include <Word.au3> 
_WordDocPropertySet ( ByRef $o_object, $v_property, $v_newvalue )

###Parameters###
@@ParamTable@@
$o_object
	Object variable of a Word.Application, document object
$v_property
	Property selection (see remarks)
$v_newvalue
	The new value to be set into the Word Document Property
@@End@@

###ReturnValue###
@@ReturnTable@@
Success:	Returns 1
Failure:	Returns 0 and sets @ERROR
@Error:	0 ($_WordStatus_Success) = No Error
	1 ($_WordStatus_GeneralError) = General Error
	2 ($_WordStatus_ComError) = Com Error
	3 ($_WordStatus_InvalidDataType) = Invalid Data Type
	4 ($_WordStatus_InvalidObjectType) = Invalid Object Type
	5 ($_WordStatus_InvalidValue) = Invalid Value
@Extended:	Contains invalid parameter number
@@End@@


###Remarks###
You may use either the index or name as the property selection.

The following tables provide a description of each property available for use.

<b><u>Word Document Properties</u></b>

@@ParamTable@@
<b>Property Index/Name</b>
	<b>Description</b>
(1) "title"
	Title.
(2) "subject"
	Subject.
(3) "author"
	Author.
(4) "keywords"
	Keywords.
(5) "comments"
	Comments.
(6) "template"
	Template name.
(9) "application name"
	Name of application.
(18) "category"
	Category.
(20) "manager"
	Manager.
(21) "company"
	Company.
(29) "hyperlink base"
	When a relative link is based on a path you specify (the first part of the path that is shared by the file containing the hyperlink and the destination file), that path is the hyperlink base.
@@END@@
